skill.name: snippet-manager
skill.description: Save, organize, search, and retrieve code snippets with tags, categories, and smart search capabi...
skill.summary: Save, organize, search, and retrieve code snippets with tags, categories, and smart search capabi...
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. The SKILL.md file contains only documentation, instructions, and code examples for the AI. No network calls, filesystem access, or command execution capabilities were detected.

content.value_statement: Developers waste time recreating code patterns they have written before. This skill helps save, organize, search, and retrieve code snippets with tags, categories, and smart search.
actual_capabilities: Save code snippets with metadata like language, tags, and description
Search snippets by language, tags, keywords, or framework
Organize snippets by category and create collections
Retrieve relevant snippets based on current context
Add usage examples and document parameters for saved snippets
Version snippet variations and track changes
limitations: Does not persist snippets across separate sessions
No built-in team sharing or collaboration features
Does not execute or validate code snippets

use_cases.title: Build Personal Code Library
use_cases.description: Save and organize reusable code patterns for quick retrieval during development work.

use_cases.title: Reference Code Examples
use_cases.description: Maintain a categorized collection of code examples for documentation and tutorials.

use_cases.title: Create Pattern Collections
use_cases.description: Organize teaching examples by concept difficulty and programming language.

prompt_templates.title: Save a Snippet
prompt_templates.prompt: Save this code as a snippet called [name]. Language: [language]. Add tags: [tag1, tag2]. Category: [category]. Description: [description].

prompt_templates.title: Search by Language
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all snippets in [language] related to [topic].

prompt_templates.title: Search by Framework
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for snippets tagged with [framework] or [library].

prompt_templates.title: Get Context Suggestions
prompt_templates.prompt: Based on this code context: [code or description], suggest relevant snippets from my library.

output_examples.input: Save a debounce function as a snippet with tags debounce, performance, and optimization.
output: Description: A reusable debounce function for rate-limiting function calls
Usage: Wrap frequently called functions to limit execution rate

best_practices: Use descriptive names and comprehensive tags for easy searching
Include usage examples and parameter documentation with each snippet
Organize snippets by category and review them periodically for relevance
anti_patterns: Saving snippets without clear descriptions or tags makes them hard to find later
Storing incomplete or untested code fragments can cause bugs when reused
Creating overly generic snippets without specific use cases reduces their usefulness

faq.question: Which programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: The skill works with any language. Code examples in the skill cover JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, SQL, and more.

faq.question: How many snippets can I save?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit. The skill can manage as many snippets as you need to organize effectively.

faq.question: Can I use this with other AI tools?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill is compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for various AI-assisted development workflows.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill with no external network access. Snippets exist only within your current AI session context.

faq.question: Why are my snippets not persisting?
faq.answer: This skill does not store snippets externally. Each AI session starts fresh. Consider documenting snippets externally for persistence.

faq.question: How does this compare to VS Code snippet managers?
faq.answer: This skill works within AI conversations to suggest and retrieve patterns. VS Code snippets are editor-specific and persistent but lack AI-powered context matching.
